result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis M. Elmer Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall pay child support as ordered in Lafayette County Circuit Court Case No. 06-FA-57.

Defendant shall consent to a reasonable request of a law enforcement officer, based on probable cause, to submit to a breath, blood, saliva, or urine test for purposes of determining the quantity of alcohol or drugs in defendant's breath, blood, saliva, or urine.
Defendant shall participate in any and all counseling deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall abide by all other terms and conditions of probation deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations thereof.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis M. Elmer Jr.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:16 PM.
Defendant Curtis M. Elmer in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter is resolved.
State files amended information.
Defendant changes plea from "NOT GUILTY" to "GUILTY" to the amended charge.
Attorney Taylor files plea and waiver form with the court.
Court questions defendant re: plea and waiver of rights, court also questions attorney Tayler re: his clients plea and waiver of rights.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, knowingly and intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY" to the amended charge.
State moves for joint recommendation of the parties.
Attorney Taylor makes statement on behalf of his client.
Court grants motion of the parties, and orders defendant be placed on probation for a period for 12 months with conditions.
Status conference on December 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Case called at 9:05 AM.
Defendant Curtis M. Elmer in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bucher informs the court that an offer has not yet been made and moves to continue.
No objection
Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for December 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on November 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.
